channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Inflation remains elevated as Trump's tariffs take hold
item.description: Inflation remained elevated last month as President Trump's tariffs continued to make their way into the prices that consumers pay. The average cost o...

item.title: The hidden costs of cutting Medicaid
item.description: Cutting Medicaid can seem like an easy way to slash the budget. But, the costs can spread to all of us.

item.title: Alaska was once a full-fledged Russian colony. Now it's hosting a U.S.-Russia summit
item.description: Russia lost a war in Crimea in the 1850s. To pay off war debts, Russia sold Alaska to the U.S. Now presidents Trump and Putin will meet Friday in Alas...

item.title: D.C. residents express concern over crime crackdown. And, Ford invests big in EVs
item.description: Washington, D.C., residents express concerns over what Trump's crime crackdown could mean for them. And, Ford plans to invest billions in building a n...

item.title: Why lung cancer is a 'hidden epidemic' in this part of the world
item.description: Rates of the world's deadliest cancer appear to be low in sub-Saharan Africa. But that statistic is masking the scope of the disease, doctors say.

item.title: President Trump says meeting with Russia's Putin is not to broker peace deal in Ukraine
item.description: President Trump is set to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday in Alaska, but Mr. Trump said the purpose of the meeting is not to brok...

item.title: CDC workers call for better protections after deadly shooting at Atlanta headquarters
item.description: Following the deadly shooting outside the CDC headquarters in Atlanta on Friday, some workers are now calling for better protections. One police offic...

item.title: Dozens killed in attack on Sudan camp for people who had fled war
item.description: An aid group in Abu Shouk camp says at least 40 were killed by gunmen from the Rapid Support Forces.

item.title: What to know about President Trump's federal takeover of Washington, D.C.'s police department
item.description: President Trump has ordered federal authorities to take control of the Washington, D.C., police department. He claims there's a crime emergency, but W...

item.title: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth belongs to an archconservative church network. Hereâ€™s what to know
Video shows steel workers scrambling into wreckage left by explosion that killed 2 in Pennsylvania
item.description: After an explosion rocked a steel plant outside Pittsburgh, workers scrambled into the wreckage alongside firefighters directing streams of water.

item.title: Madonna urges Pope to visit Gaza 'before it's too late'
item.description: The US pop star says the pontiff is "the only one of us who cannot be denied entry".

item.title: British soldiers using sex workers in Kenya despite ban, inquiry finds
item.description: Chief of Defence Staff Sir Roly Walker says the army is committed to stopping sexual exploitation.

item.title: 8/12: CBS Morning News
item.description: President Trump deploys National Guard to D.C., takes control of local police; NAACP launches town halls to mobilize Black voters ahead of 2026 midter...

item.title: Wisconsin woman found guilty 6 years after failed assassination in U.K.
item.description: Aimee Betro covered her face in a niqab as she climbed out of a car in 2019 and tried to shoot a man at point-blank range, prosecutors said.

item.title: Israel bombards Gaza City as UK and allies demand action against 'unfolding famine'
item.description: The countries demanded "immediate, permanent and concrete steps" to facilitate the entry of aid to Gaza.

item.title: US and China extend trade truce to avoid tariffs hike
item.description: The US will hold its levy on Chinese imports at 30%, while China will keep a 10% tariff on American goods.

item.title: Shooter kills 3 in a Target parking lot in Austin, Texas, before being captured, police say
